intro: Tristellateia africana var. somalensis, commonly known as the Somali starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
